edu.um.cps2004.task1.robot

Interface TTTRobot


  • public interface TTTRobot
    This interface defines the behaviour of a Tic Tac Toe Robot. All Tic Tac Toe players should implement this class, since it is the way the game engine 'interacts' with the players
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    JP

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getRobotMasterName()
      Simply returns a String with the name of the Robot creator (e.g.
      int play(GameBoard board, Mark turn)
      Defines the actual playing logic for the Robot.

    • Method Detail

      • getRobotMasterName

        java.lang.String getRobotMasterName()
        Simply returns a String with the name of the Robot creator (e.g. "James Gosling"). This is used mostly for display purposes and to give a friendly name to the Robot (other than a class name - yuck!!)
        Returns:
        The name of the robot master, never null

      • play

        int play(GameBoard board,
         Mark turn)
        Defines the actual playing logic for the Robot.
        Parameters:
        board - The current game board state - empty at first. Never Null
        turn - The players turn, either X or O should play on the given board. Never Null
        Returns:
        The position at which to play the turn mark (2nd parameter above). Must be an integer from 0 to board.getBoardSize() - 1. If integer is outside this range the robot loses. Also if the position is already taken, the robot loses.
